title: STRONGLY URGING THE REAL ESTATE COMMISSION TO ALLOW FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE REAL ESTATE SALESPERSON'S EXAMINATION IN THE JAPANESE LANGUAGE FOR PURPOSES OF ISSUING A LIMITED REAL ESTATE SALESPERSON'S LICENSE, FOR THE SALE OF TIMESHARE PRODUCTS IN HAWAII, TO JAPANESE NATIONAL VISITORS FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENHANCING JAPAN'S INVOLVEMENT IN AND SUPPORT OF THE HAWAII TOURISM INDUSTRY.
subject: Japanese Language
Real Estate Salesperson's Examination
Timeshare Products

actions.description: Resolution adopted in final form.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 869).
Report and Resolution Adopted.  Aye(s) with reservations: none. Noes, 1 (Senator(s) Awa). Transmitted to House.
One Day Notice 04-23-25
Waived referral to CPN.
Report adopted, referred to CPN.
Reported from EDT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1876), with recommendation of referral to CPN.

The committee(s) on EDT recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED.  The votes in EDT were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) DeCoite, Wakai; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Fukunaga ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Kim, Awa.
The committee(s) on EDT has scheduled a public hearing on 04-10-25 1:01PM; Conference Room 229 & Videoconference.
Referred to EDT, CPN.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 525).
Adopted as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Garcia, Iwamoto, Muraoka, Pierick voting no (4) and  Representative(s) Cochran, Woodson excused (2).
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1829) as amended in HD 1, recommending adoption.

The committee on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 6 Ayes: Representative(s) Matayoshi, Chun, Ichiyama, Kong, Lowen, Marten; Ayes with reservations: none; 2 Noes: Representative(s) Iwamoto, Pierick; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Ilagan, Tam.
Resolution scheduled to be heard by CPC on Tuesday, 04-01-25 2:00PM in conference room 329 VIA VIDEOCONFERENCE.

Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Garcia, Muraoka, Pierick voting no (3) and Representative(s) Hashem, Hussey, Templo, Ward excused (4).
Reported from TOU (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1583), recommending referral to CPC.

The committee on TOU recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 5 Ayes: Representative(s) Tam, Templo, Holt, Ilagan, Todd; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Hussey, Matsumoto.
Resolution scheduled to be heard by TOU on Thursday, 03-20-25 10:00AM in conference room 423 VIA VIDEOCONFERENCE.
Referred to TOU, CPC, referral sheet 22
Offered
